Name: CSA Cloud Controls Matrix (CCM) v4.0.13
Description: The Cloud Security Alliance (CSA) Cloud Controls Matrix (CCM) is a cybersecurity control framework for cloud computing, composed of 197 control objectives structured in 17 domains covering all key aspects of cloud technology. The CCM can be used as a tool for the systematic assessment of a cloud implementation, and provides guidance on which security controls should be implemented by which actor within the cloud supply chain.

Requirements.Description: Conduct independent audit and assurance assessments according to relevant standards at least annually.
Requirements.Name: Independent Assessments

Requirements.Description: Verify compliance with all relevant standards, regulations, legal/contractual, and statutory requirements applicable to the audit.
Requirements.Name: Requirements Compliance

Requirements.Description: Define and implement a SDLC process for application design, development, deployment, and operation in accordance with security requirements defined by the organization.
Requirements.Name: Secure Application Design and Development

Requirements.Description: Implement a testing strategy, including criteria for acceptance of new information systems, upgrades and new versions, which provides application security assurance and maintains compliance while enabling organizational speed of delivery goals. Automate when applicable and possible.
Requirements.Name: Automated Application Security Testing

Requirements.Description: Define and implement a process to remediate application security vulnerabilities, automating remediation when possible.
Requirements.Name: Application Vulnerability Remediation

Requirements.Description: Periodically backup data stored in the cloud. Ensure the confidentiality, integrity and availability of the backup, and verify data restoration from backup for resiliency.
Requirements.Name: Backup

Attributes.Section: Business Continuity Management and Operational Resilience

Requirements.Description: Establish, document, approve, communicate, apply, evaluate and maintain a disaster response plan to recover from natural and man-made disasters. Update the plan at least annually or upon significant changes.
Requirements.Name: Disaster Response Plan

Attributes.Section: Business Continuity Management and Operational Resilience

Requirements.Description: Supplement business-critical equipment with redundant equipment independently located at a reasonable minimum distance in accordance with applicable industry standards.
Requirements.Name: Equipment Redundancy

Attributes.Section: Business Continuity Management and Operational Resilience

Requirements.Description: Restrict the unauthorized addition, removal, update, and management of organization assets.
Requirements.Name: Unauthorized Change Protection

Requirements.Description: Implement detection measures with proactive notification in case of changes deviating from the established baseline.
Requirements.Name: Detection of Baseline Deviation

Requirements.Description: Provide cryptographic protection to data at-rest and in-transit, using cryptographic libraries certified to approved standards.
Requirements.Name: Data Encryption

Requirements.Description: Use encryption algorithms that are appropriate for data protection, considering the classification of data, associated risks, and usability of the encryption technology.
Requirements.Name: Encryption Algorithm

Requirements.Description: CSPs must provide the capability for CSCs to manage their own data encryption keys.
Requirements.Name: CSC Key Management Capability

Requirements.Description: Generate Cryptographic keys using industry accepted cryptographic libraries specifying the algorithm strength and the random number generator used.
Requirements.Name: Key Generation

Requirements.Description: Rotate cryptographic keys in accordance with the calculated cryptoperiod, which includes provisions for considering the risk of information disclosure and legal and regulatory requirements.
Requirements.Name: Key Rotation

Requirements.Description: Define, implement and evaluate processes, procedures and technical measures to destroy keys stored outside a secure environment and revoke keys stored in Hardware Security Modules (HSMs) when they are no longer needed, which include provisions for legal and regulatory requirements.
Requirements.Name: Key Destruction

Requirements.Description: Catalogue and track all relevant physical and logical assets located at all of the CSP's sites within a secured system.
Requirements.Name: Assets Cataloguing and Tracking

Requirements.Description: Apply industry accepted methods for the secure disposal of data from storage media such that data is not recoverable by any forensic means.
Requirements.Name: Secure Disposal

Attributes.Section: Data Security and Privacy Lifecycle Management

Requirements.Description: Create and maintain a data inventory, at least for any sensitive data and personal data.
Requirements.Name: Data Inventory

Attributes.Section: Data Security and Privacy Lifecycle Management

Requirements.Description: Classify data according to its type and sensitivity level.
Requirements.Name: Data Classification

Attributes.Section: Data Security and Privacy Lifecycle Management

Requirements.Description: Develop systems, products, and business practices based upon a principle of security by design and industry best practices.
Requirements.Name: Data Protection by Design and Default

Attributes.Section: Data Security and Privacy Lifecycle Management

Requirements.Description: Define, implement and evaluate processes, procedures and technical measures that ensure any transfer of personal or sensitive data is protected from unauthorized access and only processed within scope as permitted by the respective laws and regulations.
Requirements.Name: Sensitive Data Transfer

Attributes.Section: Data Security and Privacy Lifecycle Management

Requirements.Description: Data retention, archiving and deletion is managed in accordance with business requirements, applicable laws and regulations.
Requirements.Name: Data Retention and Deletion

Attributes.Section: Data Security and Privacy Lifecycle Management

Requirements.Description: Define and implement, processes, procedures and technical measures to protect sensitive data throughout it's lifecycle.
Requirements.Name: Sensitive Data Protection

Attributes.Section: Data Security and Privacy Lifecycle Management

Requirements.Description: Develop and implement an Information Security Program, which includes programs for all the relevant domains of the CCM.
Requirements.Name: Information Security Program

Requirements.Description: Establish, document, approve, communicate, implement, apply, evaluate and maintain strong password policies and procedures. Review and update the policies and procedures at least annually.
Requirements.Name: Strong Password Policy and Procedures

Requirements.Description: Manage, store, and review the information of system identities, and level of access.
Requirements.Name: Identity Inventory

Requirements.Description: Employ the separation of duties principle when implementing information system access.
Requirements.Name: Separation of Duties

Requirements.Description: Employ the least privilege principle when implementing information system access.
Requirements.Name: Least Privilege

Requirements.Description: De-provision or respectively modify access of movers / leavers or system identity changes in a timely manner in order to effectively adopt and communicate identity and access management policies.
Requirements.Name: User Access Changes and Revocation

Requirements.Description: Review and revalidate user access for least privilege and separation of duties with a frequency that is commensurate with organizational risk tolerance.
Requirements.Name: User Access Review

Requirements.Description: Define, implement and evaluate processes, procedures and technical measures for the segregation of privileged access roles such that administrative access to data, encryption and key management capabilities and logging capabilities are distinct and separated.
Requirements.Name: Segregation of Privileged Access Roles

Requirements.Description: Define and implement an access process to ensure privileged access roles and rights are granted for a time limited period, and implement procedures to prevent the culmination of segregated privileged access.
Requirements.Name: Management of Privileged Access Roles

Requirements.Description: Define, implement and evaluate processes, procedures and technical measures to ensure the logging infrastructure is read-only for all with write access, including privileged access roles, and that the ability to disable it is controlled through a procedure that ensures the segregation of duties and break glass procedures.
Requirements.Name: Safeguard Logs Integrity

Requirements.Description: Define, implement and evaluate processes, procedures and technical measures that ensure users are identifiable through unique IDs or which can associate individuals to the usage of user IDs.
Requirements.Name: Uniquely Identifiable Users

Requirements.Description: Define, implement and evaluate processes, procedures and technical measures for authenticating access to systems, application and data assets, including multifactor authentication for at least privileged user and sensitive data access. Adopt digital certificates or alternatives which achieve an equivalent level of security for system identities.
Requirements.Name: Strong Authentication

Requirements.Description: Define, implement and evaluate processes, procedures and technical measures for the secure management of passwords.
Requirements.Name: Passwords Management

Requirements.Description: Define, implement and evaluate processes, procedures and technical measures to verify access to data and system functions is authorized.
Requirements.Name: Authorization Mechanisms

Requirements.Description: Implement cryptographically secure and standardized network protocols for the management, import and export of data.
Requirements.Name: Secure Interoperability and Portability Management

Requirements.Description: Plan and monitor the availability, quality, and adequate capacity of resources in order to deliver the required system performance as determined by the business.
Requirements.Name: Capacity and Resource Planning

Requirements.Description: Monitor, encrypt and restrict communications between environments to only authenticated and authorized connections, as justified by the business. Review these configurations at least annually, and support them by a documented justification of all allowed services, protocols, ports, and compensating controls.
Requirements.Name: Network Security

Requirements.Description: Harden host and guest OS, hypervisor or infrastructure control plane according to their respective best practices, and supported by technical controls, as part of a security baseline.
Requirements.Name: OS Hardening and Base Controls

Requirements.Description: Design, develop, deploy and configure applications and infrastructures such that CSP and CSC (tenant) user access and intra-tenant access is appropriately segmented and segregated, monitored and restricted from other tenants.
Requirements.Name: Segmentation and Segregation

Requirements.Description: Use secure and encrypted communication channels when migrating servers, services, applications, or data to cloud environments. Such channels must include only up-to-date and approved protocols.
Requirements.Name: Migration to Cloud Environments

Requirements.Description: Define, implement and evaluate processes, procedures and defense-in-depth techniques for protection, detection, and timely response to network-based attacks.
Requirements.Name: Network Defense

Requirements.Description: Define, implement and evaluate processes, procedures and technical measures to ensure the security and retention of audit logs.
Requirements.Name: Audit Logs Protection

Requirements.Description: Identify and monitor security-related events within applications and the underlying infrastructure. Define and implement a system to generate alerts to responsible stakeholders based on such events and corresponding metrics.
Requirements.Name: Security Monitoring and Alerting

Requirements.Description: Restrict audit logs access to authorized personnel and maintain records that provide unique access accountability.
Requirements.Name: Audit Logs Access and Accountability

Requirements.Description: Monitor security audit logs to detect activity outside of typical or expected patterns. Establish and follow a defined process to review and take appropriate and timely actions on detected anomalies.
Requirements.Name: Audit Logs Monitoring and Response

Requirements.Description: Establish, document and implement which information meta/data system events should be logged. Review and update the scope at least annually or whenever there is a change in the threat environment.
Requirements.Name: Logging Scope

Requirements.Description: Generate audit records containing relevant security information.
Requirements.Name: Log Records

Requirements.Description: The information system protects audit records from unauthorized access, modification, and deletion.
Requirements.Name: Log Protection

Requirements.Description: Establish and maintain a monitoring and internal reporting capability over the operations of cryptographic, encryption and key management policies, processes, procedures, and controls.
Requirements.Name: Encryption Monitoring and Reporting

Requirements.Description: Log and monitor key lifecycle management events to enable auditing and reporting on usage of cryptographic keys.
Requirements.Name: Transaction/Activity Logging

Requirements.Description: Define, implement and evaluate processes, procedures and technical measures for the reporting of anomalies and failures of the monitoring system and provide immediate notification to the accountable party.
Requirements.Name: Failures and Anomalies Reporting

Requirements.Description: 'Establish, document, approve, communicate, apply, evaluate and maintain a security incident response plan, which includes but is not limited to: relevant internal departments, impacted CSCs, and other business critical relationships (such as supply-chain) that may be impacted.'
Requirements.Name: Incident Response Plans

Attributes.Section: Security Incident Management, E-Discovery, & Cloud Forensics

Requirements.Description: Define, implement and evaluate processes, procedures and technical measures supporting business processes to triage security-related events.
Requirements.Name: Event Triage Processes

Attributes.Section: Security Incident Management, E-Discovery, & Cloud Forensics

Requirements.Description: Maintain points of contact for applicable regulation authorities, national and local law enforcement, and other legal jurisdictional authorities.
Requirements.Name: Points of Contact Maintenance

Attributes.Section: Security Incident Management, E-Discovery, & Cloud Forensics

Requirements.Description: Establish, document, approve, communicate, apply, evaluate and maintain policies and procedures to protect against malware on managed assets. Review and update the policies and procedures at least annually.
Requirements.Name: Malware Protection Policy and Procedures

Requirements.Description: Define, implement and evaluate processes, procedures and technical measures to enable both scheduled and emergency responses to vulnerability identifications, based on the identified risk.
Requirements.Name: Vulnerability Remediation Schedule

Requirements.Description: Define, implement and evaluate processes, procedures and technical measures to update detection tools, threat signatures, and indicators of compromise on a weekly, or more frequent basis.
Requirements.Name: Detection Updates

Requirements.Description: Define, implement and evaluate processes, procedures and technical measures to identify updates for applications which use third party or open source libraries according to the organization's vulnerability management policy.
Requirements.Name: External Library Vulnerabilities

Requirements.Description: Define, implement and evaluate processes, procedures and technical measures for the detection of vulnerabilities on organizationally managed assets at least monthly.
Requirements.Name: Vulnerability Identification

Requirements.Description: Protect information from unauthorized disclosure on managed endpoint devices with storage encryption.
Requirements.Name: Storage Encryption

Requirements.Description: Configure managed endpoints with Data Loss Prevention (DLP) technologies and rules in accordance with a risk assessment.
Requirements.Name: Data Loss Prevention
